Event.name: Nuclear_process
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Initial_element</fen> is converted into a <fen>Final_element</fen> via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the <fen>Element</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Element">5.5 percent of nucleii</fex> <t>decay</t> <fex name="Initial_element">from tritium</fex> <fex name="Final_element">to He3</fex> <fex name="Period_of_iterations">in a year</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Element
Arg.definition: <def-root>A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up. </def-root>

Arg.name: Final_element
Arg.definition: <def-root>The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.</def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_element
Arg.definition: <def-root>The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Change event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>) and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Element</fen>'s substance is converted to the <fen>Final_element</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The physical or abstract <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the change takes place. </def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event or state that causes the change to take place. </def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the nuclear process occurs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: fissile.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of an atom or element) able to undergo nuclear fission.

lexUnit.name: decay.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of undergoing change to a different form by emitting radiation.

lexUnit.name: decay.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a radioactive substance, particle, etc.) undergo change to a different form by emitting radiation.

lexUnit.name: fuse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join, blend, or coalesce to form a single entity.

lexUnit.name: fusion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process or result of fusing.

lexUnit.name: fission.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of splitting or being split into two or more parts.

lexUnit.name: nuclear.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relating to or using energy released in nuclear fission or fusion.

lexUnit.name: thermonuclear.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (chiefly with reference to weapons) using or denoting nuclear fusion reactions that occur at very high temperatures.

lexUnit.name: fusable.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: able to undergo nuclear fusion

lexUnit.name: radioactive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: emitting or relating to the emission of ionizing radiation or particles.

lexUnit.name: radioactivity.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the emission of ionizing radiation or particles caused by the spontaneous disintegration of atomic nuclei.
